content.question: If <math alttext="f of x equals, the natural log of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, the fraction with numerator f of 2, minus f of x, and denominator x minus 2, end fraction, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="negative, the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.7: Derivatives of cos x, sin x, ex, and ln x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
